memberdef.argsstring: (wxXmlNode *parent, wxXmlNodeType type, const wxString &name, const wxString &content=wxEmptyString, wxXmlAttribute *attrs=NULL, wxXmlNode *next=NULL, int lineNo=-1)
memberdef.name: wxXmlNode

briefdescription.para: Creates this XML node and eventually insert it into an existing XML tree.

parameterdescription.para: The parent node to which append this node instance. If this argument is NULL this new node will be floating and it can be appended later to another one using the AddChild() or InsertChild() functions. Otherwise the child is already added to the XML tree by this constructor and it shouldn't be done again.
One of the wxXmlNodeType enumeration value.
The name of the node. This is the string which appears between angular brackets.
The content of the node. Only meaningful when type is wxXML_TEXT_NODE or wxXML_CDATA_SECTION_NODE.
If not NULL, this wxXmlAttribute object and its eventual siblings are attached to the node.
If not NULL, this node and its eventual siblings are attached to the node.
Number of line this node was present at in input file or -1.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxXmlNodeType type, const wxString &name, const wxString &content=wxEmptyString, int lineNo=-1)
memberdef.name: wxXmlNode

briefdescription.para: A simplified version of the first constructor form, assuming a NULL parent.

parameterdescription.para: One of the wxXmlNodeType enumeration value.
The name of the node. This is the string which appears between angular brackets.
The content of the node. Only meaningful when type is wxXML_TEXT_NODE or wxXML_CDATA_SECTION_NODE.
Number of line this node was present at in input file or -1.

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Note that this does NOT copy siblings and parent pointer, i.e. GetParent() and GetNext() will return NULL after using copy ctor and are never unmodified by operator=(). On the other hand, it DOES copy children and attributes.

briefdescription.para: The virtual destructor.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes attached children and attributes.

briefdescription.para: Appends a attribute with given name and value to the list of attributes for this node.
Appends given attribute to the list of attributes for this node.
Adds node child as the last child of this node.

simplesect.para: Note that this function works in O(n) time where n is the number of existing children. Consequently, adding large number of child nodes using this method can be expensive, because it has O(n^2) time complexity in number of nodes to be added. Use InsertChildAfter() to populate XML tree in linear time.

briefdescription.para: Removes the first attributes which has the given name from the list of attributes for this node.
Returns true if a attribute named attrName could be found.

detaileddescription.para: The value of that attribute is saved in value (which must not be NULL).

briefdescription.para: Returns the value of the attribute named attrName if it does exist.

detaileddescription.para: If it does not exist, the defaultVal is returned.

briefdescription.para: Return a pointer to the first attribute of this node.
Returns the first child of this node.

detaileddescription.para: To get a pointer to the second child of this node (if it does exist), use the GetNext() function on the returned value.

briefdescription.para: Returns the content of this node.

detaileddescription.para: Can be an empty string. Be aware that for nodes of type wxXML_ELEMENT_NODE (the most used node type) the content is an empty string. See GetNodeContent() for more details.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of nodes which separate this node from grandparent.

detaileddescription.para: This function searches only the parents of this node until it finds grandparent or the NULL node (which is the parent of non-linked nodes or the parent of a wxXmlDocument's root element node).

briefdescription.para: Returns a flag indicating whether encoding conversion is necessary when saving.

detaileddescription.para: The default is false.
You can improve saving efficiency considerably by setting this value.

briefdescription.para: Returns line number of the node in the input XML file or -1 if it is unknown.
Returns the name of this node.

detaileddescription.para: Can be an empty string (e.g. for nodes of type wxXML_TEXT_NODE or wxXML_CDATA_SECTION_NODE).

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the sibling of this node or NULL if there are no siblings.
Returns the content of the first child node of type wxXML_TEXT_NODE or wxXML_CDATA_SECTION_NODE.

detaileddescription.para: This function is very useful since the XML snippet "tagnametagcontent/tagname" is represented by expat with the following tag tree:
or eventually:
An empty string is returned if the node has no children of type wxXML_TEXT_NODE or wxXML_CDATA_SECTION_NODE, or if the content of the first child of such types is empty.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the parent of this node or NULL if this node has no parent.
Returns the type of this node.
Returns true if this node has a attribute named attrName.
Inserts the child node immediately before followingNode in the children list.

simplesect.para: true if followingNode has been found and the child node has been inserted.

For historical reasons, followingNode may be NULL. In that case, then child is prepended to the list of children and becomes the first child of this node, i.e. it behaves identically to using the first children (as returned by GetChildren()) for followingNode).

briefdescription.para: Inserts the child node immediately after precedingNode in the children list.

simplesect.para: true if precedingNode has been found and the child node has been inserted.

parameterdescription.para: The node to insert child after. As a special case, this can be NULL if this node has no children yet -- in that case, child will become this node's only child node.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the content of this node is a string containing only whitespaces (spaces, tabs, new lines, etc).

detaileddescription.para: Note that this function is locale-independent since the parsing of XML documents must always produce the exact same tree regardless of the locale it runs under.

briefdescription.para: Removes the given node from the children list.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the node was found and removed or false if the node could not be found. Note that the caller is responsible for deleting the removed node in order to avoid memory leaks.

briefdescription.para: Sets as first attribute the given wxXmlAttribute object.

detaileddescription.para: The caller is responsible for deleting any previously present attributes attached to this node.

briefdescription.para: Sets as first child the given node.

detaileddescription.para: The caller is responsible for deleting any previously present children node.

briefdescription.para: Sets the content of this node.
Sets the name of this node.
Sets as sibling the given node.

detaileddescription.para: The caller is responsible for deleting any previously present sibling node.

briefdescription.para: Sets a flag to indicate whether encoding conversion is necessary when saving.

detaileddescription.para: The default is false.
You can improve saving efficiency considerably by setting this value.

briefdescription.para: Sets as parent the given node.

detaileddescription.para: The caller is responsible for deleting any previously present parent node.

briefdescription.para: Sets the type of this node.
See the copy constructor for more info.
Represents a node in an XML document.

detaileddescription.para: See wxXmlDocument.
Node has a name and may have content and attributes.
Most common node types are wxXML_TEXT_NODE (name and attributes are irrelevant) and wxXML_ELEMENT_NODE.
Example: in <title>hi</title> there is an element with the name title and irrelevant content and one child of type wxXML_TEXT_NODE with hi as content.

The wxXML_PI_NODE type sets the name to the PI target and the contents to the instructions. Note that whilst the PI instructions are often in the form of pseudo-attributes these do not use the nodes attribute system. It is the users responsibility to code and decode the instruction text.
If wxUSE_UNICODE is 0, all strings are encoded in the encoding given to wxXmlDocument::Load (default is UTF-8).
Library:wxXML
Category:XML
